SafetyInspectionBy: TAI Engineers, Managers, and Technical Services

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Pesticide and Other Agricultural Chemical Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Anitox has spent over 20 years developing agricultural chemical products to control microbiological, mold and toxin contamination of animal feed and feed ingredients.  Through an extensive Research and Development Center located in Lawrenceville, Georgia, Anitox has developed animal feed additives that enable all species of animals to grow healthier, faster and more economical.  Anitox, and its products, are dedicated to consumer food safety, which begins with animal production.

A primary goal for senior management at Anitox, as well as all employees, is to eliminate, or control, both known and potential safety and health hazards that exist in the work place.  Anitox goes to great lengths to accomplish this goal including the use of proper equipment, materials, manufacturing procedures and trained employees.  Anitox is committed to do all that is reasonable to protect our employees, our customers and the public from results of chemical releases or fire.  Anitox has not experienced any accidents in the last five years or since the last revision of the Risk Management Plan. 

In preparation for an emergency, Anitox insures that all public service agencies responsible for emergency response are kept informed and updated on the Anitox emergency response plan.  These agencies include, but are not limited to, the Russellville Fire Department, the Dover Fire Department and the Pope County Emergency Services.  Anitox has conducted facility tours, product training and issued copies of the emergency response plan to these agencies.  The National Response Center and the State of Arkansas Emergency Response Commission must be notified immediately in the event of a chemical release.  

Anhydrous Ammonia is used in the manufacturing facility at Anitox to produce animal feed additives.  The Environmental Protection Agency and the Occupational Safety and Health Administration have determined anhydrous ammonia to be a hazardous material.  Both governmental agencies have issued regu

latory requirements addressing the storage and use of anhydrous ammonia.  Anitox has incorporated into its safety programs the regulatory requirements of both Process Safety Management and Risk Management programs.  These regulatory programs include a focus on manufacturing procedures, safety procedures, proper maintenance of processing equipment that handle hazardous materials as well as employee training in all of these areas.  

Anitox continually strives to stay informed of new technology in the areas of safety and manufacturing processes.  Continuous training of on-site personnel and emergency response agencies enables Anitox to respond quickly and effectively to emergencies should they occur.  Anitox is committed to uphold our reputation as environmental stewards within the community.  Anitox views itself as a business partner who, in conjunction with other businesses and the general public, can preserve and protect the environment in which we all live.

Respectfully,

Jan Kvist
Global Operations Director
